channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Use ADMX templates on Windows 10/11 devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Administrative templates in Microsoft Intune to create groups of settings for Windows 10/11 client devices. Use these settings in a device configuration profile. You can control Office programs, Microsoft Edge, access OneDrive, use remote desktop, enable Auto-Play, set power management settings, use HTTP printing, control user sign-in, and change the event log size.

item.title: Restrict USB devices using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to restrict USB devices, including thumb drives, flash drives, USB cameras, and more. Use other settings to allow specific USB devices on Windows 10/11 devices.

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Configure Universal Print policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to create a Universal Print policy for Windows 10/11 client devices. The policy automatically installs printers on your managed devices.

item.title: Use Microsoft Defender for Endpoint in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune as a Mobile Threat Defense solution.

item.title: Common tasks and features in the settings catalog
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure common features. You can create a Universal Print policy, configure Microsoft Edge and Google Chrome web browsers, and use built in settings instead of plist files for macOS devices.

item.title: Update Microsoft 365 apps with the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to update Microsoft 365 apps to the latest version, and choose how frequently Office checks for updates. See the device registry keys that are updated when an Intune policy to Office update is applied.

item.title: Set up local admin account creation and password management for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up macOS account configuration with LAPS through automatic device enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Deploy Microsoft Edge policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create settings using the settings catalog to configure Microsoft Edge on Windows and macOS devices. Using Microsoft Intune, you can configure group policy settings, and deploy these settings to Microsoft Edge users.

item.title: Endpoint management services and solutions at Microsoft
item.description: Microsoft Intune is a family of on-premises products and cloud services. It includes Intune, Configuration Manager, co-management, Endpoint Analytics, Windows Autopilot, and the admin center to manage cloud devices and on on-premises.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Run remote actions on devices with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to run remote actions on Android, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Windows devices. You can reset the password, lock the device, wipe or reset the OS, scan for viruses, and more. Use this feature to remotely manage devices and have help desk run common tasks.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Government Service overview
item.description: Learn more about the Intune government service offerings and features. This article is designed to serve as an overview of the Microsoft Intune offering for government community cloud (GCC) High and United States Department of Defense (DoD) environments.

item.title: Deployment guide for Windows device management
item.description: Use our platform deployment guide to set up Windows device management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Data storage and processing in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how personal data is stored and processed in Intune.

item.title: Remotely administer devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the required roles to use TeamViewer, how to install the TeamViewer connector, and step-by-step guidance to remotely administer devices using Microsoft Intune in the Azure portal

item.title: Deployment guide to manage iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: A guide to managing iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: What is Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune manages users and devices, simplifies app management and automated policy deployment, and integrates with mobile threat defense. It connects to Managed Google Play, Apple tokens and certificates, and Teamviewer for remote assistance. Can use MDM or MAM to protect data, configure devices, and simplify access to company resources.

item.title: Third-party device compliance partners support in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a third-party device compliance partner as a source of compliance data for devices you manage with Intune.

item.title: Zero Trust with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune contributes to a strong Zero Trust strategy and architecture.

item.title: What's new in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what's new in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure the Microsoft Managed Home Screen app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to configure the Microsoft Managed Home Screen app.

item.title: Device restriction settings for Android in Microsoft Intune
item.description: On Android Enterprise or Android for Work devices owned by your organization, you can restrict settings on the device using Microsoft Intune. Allow copy and paste, notifications, app permissions, data sharing, password length, sign in failures, use fingerprint to unlock, reuse passwords, and enable bluetooth sharing of work contacts. Configure devices as a dedicated device kiosk to run one app, or multiple apps.

item.title: Manage Microsoft Edge on iOS and Android with Intune
item.description: Use Intune app protection and configuration policies with Microsoft Edge for iOS and Android to ensure corporate websites are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.title: Sync devices with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Synchronize devices that are registered or managed with Microsoft Intune to get the latest policies and actions. Includes the steps to sync by using the Azure portal, and lists the error codes that can be retried.

item.title: Configure ChromeOS connector for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to connect the Google Admin Console to Microsoft Intune so that you can view and take action on enrolled ChromeOS devices.

item.title: View and correct personal data collected by Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to view and correct personal data that's been collected by Intune.

item.title: View device details with Microsoft Intune
item.description: View your device details, including operating systems, storage space, manufacturer, and model. Get a list of installed apps, check compliance policies, and set up TeamViewer with Microsoft Intune in Azure. Similar to viewing inventory of the devices you manage.

item.title: Manage devices with endpoint security in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Security Administrators can use the Endpoint Security node to view devices and manage them in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Find the primary user of a Microsoft Intune device.
item.description: Find the primary user (or User Device Affinity) of an Intune device.

item.title: View ChromeOS device information
item.description: View ChromeOS devices and details synced with the Chrome Enterprise connector in the Microsoft Intune admin center.

item.title: Rename a device with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Rename a device by using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage approved apps for Windows devices with App Control for Business policy and Managed Installers in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use App Control for Business policies and a managed installer to manage which apps are approved to run on Windows devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension
item.description: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension for Windows.

item.title: Configure Platform SSO for macOS devices
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Platform SSO and deploy the configuration to your macOS devices. Platform SSO enables single sign-on (SSO) using Microsoft Entra ID with the Secure Enclave, smart card, or password authentication methods. You create a settings catalog policy to configure the settings. This article is a step-by-step guide to configure Platform SSO for macOS devices using Intune.

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: Platform SSO scenarios for macOS devices
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure common Platform SSO scenarios for macOS devices. You can enable Kerberos SSO to on-premises Active Directory and cloud-based Microsoft Entra ID, use Touch ID biometric policy with Secure Enclave authentication, and enable SSO on non-Microsoft apps. You can also configure end user experience settings.

item.title: Kiosk settings for Windows 10/11 in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your Windows 10/11 client devices as single-app and multi-app kiosks, customize the start menu, add apps, show the task bar, and configure a web browser in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Device restriction settings for Windows 10/11 in Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of all the settings and their descriptions for creating device restrictions on Windows 10/11 client devices. Use these settings in a configuration profile to control screenshots, password requirements, kiosk settings, apps in the store, Microsoft Edge browser, Microsoft Defender, access to the cloud, start menu, and more in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Walkthrough-Create a settings catalog policy
item.description: This tutorial or walkthrough steps through creating and comparing an on-premises Administrative Templates (ADMX) Group Policy and Microsoft Intune cloud-based settings catalog policy. It shows similar settings in on-premises and the Intune settings catalog to create and manage policies for Office, Windows, and Microsoft Edge on Windows 10/11 client devices.

item.title: Configure and secure devices with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to configure policies with Microsoft Intune in preparation for device deployment.

item.title: Configure feature updates policy for Windows 10 Windows 11 devices in Intune
item.description: Create and manage Intune policy for Windows feature updates. Configure and deploy policy to maintain the Windows feature version of Windows 10/11 devices you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Enable Windows Backup for Organizations in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Windows backup and restore in Intune for employees or students.

item.title: View declarative device management-based software update reports for Apple devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to software updates reports for managed Apple devices based on Apples declarative device management capabilities.

item.title: Planning guide to move to Microsoft Intune
item.description: Plan, design, implement, adopt, and move to Microsoft Intune. Get guidance and advice to determine goals, use-case scenarios and requirements, and create rollout and communication plans, support, testing, and validation plans.

item.title: Set up Intune enrollment for Android Enterprise dedicated devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure enrollment in Microsoft Intune for Android Enterprise dedicated devices.

item.title: Enroll personal devices in Intune with Android Enterprise work profile management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for personal devices and bring-your-own-device scenarios using Android Enterprise work profile management.

item.title: Set up Android Enterprise work profile for corporate owned devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Android Enterprise work profile for corporate-owned devices enrolling in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up enrollment for Android Enterprise fully managed devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up enrollment in Intune for devices using the Android Enterprise fully managed device management solution.

item.title: Use Remote Help to assist users authenticated by your organization.
item.description: With the Remote Help app, provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app.

item.title: Performance recommendations when using filters
item.description: When using filters in Microsoft Intune, use Intune virtual groups that don't require Microsoft Entra ID syncing. To improve performance, reuse groups, make incremental group changes, and use filters to include and exclude.

item.title: Use role-based access control (RBAC) and scope tags for distributed IT - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use role-based access control (RBAC) and scope tags to filter configuration profiles to specific roles.

item.title: Shared iOS and iPadOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Shared iOS and iPadOS devices.

item.title: Set up enrollment time grouping - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Overview and setup of the enrollment time grouping feature in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add users to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add and managing Microsoft Entra user accounts from within Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Role-based access control (RBAC) with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how RBAC lets you control who can perform actions and make changes in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Network endpoints for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review endpoints for Intune. This page lists IP addresses and port settings needed for proxy settings in your Intune deployments.

item.title: Set the mobile device management authority - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about how to set the mobile device management authority in Microsoft Intune and some key considerations.

item.title: Set up Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 1 for deploying or setting up Intune. The starting point is to review supported configurations, sign up for the trial, configure the custom domain name, add users and groups to Intune, assign licenses to users, manage roles, grant admin permissions, and set the MDM authority.

item.title: Add groups to organize users and devices for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create Microsoft Entra groups to organize users and devices for use with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: PowerShell scripts for Remediations - Microsoft Intune
item.description: PowerShell script reference for Remediations.

item.title: Using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidelines for using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Using Windows 10 virtual machines with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the general guidelines for using Windows 10 virtual machines with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Unlicensed admins in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes how to give unlicensed admins permissions to access Intune.

item.title: Create a user in Intune
item.description: Create a user in Intune.

item.title: Configure a custom domain name - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a custom domain name for your Microsoft Intune subscription

item.title: Use Remediations to detect and fix support issues
item.description: Learn more about Remediations in Microsoft Intune, including what Remediations are and view any prerequisites and licensing requirements. Also, learn how to deploy built-in and custom remediation scripts, and learn how to monitor your scripts.

item.title: Windows Delivery Optimization settings in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure device configuration policy to manage Delivery Optimization settings on Windows devices you manage with Intune.

item.title: Operating systems and browsers supported by Microsoft Intune
item.description: Lists supported device platforms and browsers for Intune device management

item.title: Assign Microsoft Intune licenses
item.description: Assign licenses to users so they can enroll in Intune

item.title: Android Open Source Project Supported Devices
item.description: Lists Android open source project devices (AOSP) supported devices

item.title: Overview of the Microsoft Intune MDM lifecycle
item.description: Learn how Intune helps you manage devices through their lifecycle - from enrollment, through configuration, to eventual retirement.

item.title: Intune classic groups in the Azure portal - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn what's new with groups in the Microsoft Intune Azure portal.

item.title: Using Azure Virtual Desktop multi-session with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidelines for using Azure Virtual Desktop multi-session with Microsoft Intune

item.title: About the Microsoft Intune tenant status page - Microsoft Intune
item.description: The Intune tenant status page displays details about your tenant and the status of connectors you've configured, and messages intended for tenants and about the Intune service health.

item.title: Licenses available for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Intune is available with these licenses

item.title: Sign up or sign in to Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to sign up for a Microsoft Intune subscription or sign in to start with your subscription.

item.title: Microsoft Cloud PKI for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: An overview of the Microsoft Cloud PKI service, available with Microsoft Intune Suite or as an Intune add-on.

item.title: Install the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to install and configure the unified Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune, which supports SCEP, PKCS, imported PKCS, and certificate revocation.

item.title: Overview of Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune - Azure
item.description: Learn about the unified Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune, which supports SCEP, PKCS, imported PKCS, and certificate revocation.

item.title: Types of certificate that are supported by Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Microsoft Intune's support for Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP), Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificates.

item.title: Create trusted certificate profiles in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and deploy trusted certificate profiles to deploy a trusted root certificate to managed devices in Intune. Trusted certificate profiles support use of Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) and Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Prerequisites for the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the software and network prerequisites for use of the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Cloud PKI root and issuing CA for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure a root and issuing CA for the Microsoft Cloud PKI service.

item.title: Deployment models for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes the deployment options for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Bring your own certificate authority with Cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a Microsoft Cloud PKI BYOCA issuing CA in Intune and anchor it to an on-premises or private CA.

item.title: Microsoft Intune cloud PKI fundamentals - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes fundamentals for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Issue DigiCert PKCS certificates with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Install and configure the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune to issue PKCS certificates from DigiCert PKI Platform to Intune-managed devices.

item.title: Monitor issued PKI certificates with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Monitor reports for certificates issued via Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Delete issued PKI certificates with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Delete certificates issued via Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Remote actions for ChromeOS devices
item.description: Remotely run Microsoft Intune device actions on ChromeOS devices in the Microsoft Intune admin center.

item.title: Use imported PFX certificates in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use imported Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificates with Microsoft Intune. Import certificates, configure certificate templates, and create an Imported PKCS Certificate profile.

item.title: Audit logs for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get audit logs for Microsoft cloud public key infrastructure (PKI) activity in the admin center.

item.title: Use a PKCS certificate profile to provision devices with certificates in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificates with Microsoft Intune, work with root certificates and certificate templates, and use device configuration profiles for a PKCS Certificate.

item.title: Sign and encrypt email using S/MIME - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use email digital certificates in Microsoft Intune to sign and encrypt emails on devices. These certificates are called S/MIME and are configured using device configuration profiles. Signing and encryption certificates use PKCS, or private certificates, and use a connector to import certificates.

item.title: Configure infrastructure to support SCEP certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune
item.description: To use Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) with Microsoft Intune, configure your on-premises AD domain, create a certification authority, and set up the NDES server to support use of the Certificate Connector.

item.title: Use third-party certification authorities (CA) with SCEP in Microsoft Intune
item.description: In Microsoft Intune, you can add a vendor or third-party certificate authority (CA) to issue certificates to mobile devices using the SCEP protocol. In this overview, a Microsoft Entra application gives Microsoft Intune permissions to validate certificates. Then, use the application ID, authentication key, and tenant ID of the Microsoft Entra application in the setup of your SCEP server to issue certificates.

item.title: Turn on iOS/iPadOS supervised mode with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to turn on iOS/iPadOS supervised mode with Intune.

item.title: Use SCEP certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and assign Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Windows device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll Windows devices using Automatic enrollment, Windows Autopilot, group policy, and co-management enrollment options in Microsoft Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.
